job_description: Mackenzie Pulp Mill Corporation has 4 month (May â€“ August 2015) Co-op/Workterm opportunities for Electrical Engineering Students.  You will work with medium & low voltage systems, process control equipment, PLC & DCS systems, project management - including planning, quality, scheduling and budget control, and maintenance troubleshooting. Mackenzie Pulp Mill Corporation is located in Mackenzie BC.  The mill produces approx. 235,000 ADMT of bleached pulp per year and employs close to 275 employees on a continuous operating schedule.  Mackenzie Pulp Mill Corporation is part of the Paper Excellence Group which owns and operates several mills in Canada, United States and Europe. Mackenzie is a community of nearly 4,000 and lies at the southern end of Williston Lake, in the Rocky Mountain Trench, 190 km north of Prince George, BC.  Mackenzie is a friendly, family-oriented town offering excellent recreational opportunities, affordable housing and all amenities.  At its doorstep is a network of trails and facilities for hiking, mountain biking, skiing, and all activities the mountains, rivers and wilderness can provide.  We invite you to visit the District of Mackenzie web site at: www.district.mackenzie.bc.ca The mill offers a dynamic work environment and an attractive wage. If you are interested in experiencing a Co-op/work term with Mackenzie Pulp, and wish to expand you knowledge please submit your resume.
